intro: Myrodia parviflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved myrtle, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a woody stem and is typically found in sandy or rocky soils. Myrodia parviflora is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it suitable for coastal gardens. Its leaves are often used in traditional Aboriginal medicine for their aromatic and therapeutic properties.
